summary: This bill, the Immersive Technology for the American Workforce Act of 2025, directs the Secretary of Labor to award competitive grants to community colleges and area career/technical education centers.  The grants support the development of immersive technology education and training programs for workforce development.  These programs aim to create career pathways using immersive tech, focusing on in-demand industries, accessibility for individuals with barriers to employment, and instructor training. The grants can last up to 5 years, and require reporting and evaluation.  The bill authorizes $50 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2035.
